value.title: Machine learning aids earthquake risk prediction
value.excerpt: Soil liquefaction was a major feature of the 2011 Christchurch, New Zealand earthquake that killed 185 people. Researchers developed a machine learning model to predict the amount of lateral movement that can be expected from liquefaction during a natural hazard event.

value.title: Using machine learning to build maps that give smarter driving advice
